title: Quiz 1: Fundamentals of Paediatric Health & Growth
description: Assessment of child growth milestones, development principles, and immunisation protocols.

questions.question: Which of the following best distinguishes 'Development' from 'Growth'?

options.text: Development is a quantitative change in size.
Development is a physiological process involving qualitative change to advanced complexity.
Development ceases at 12 months of age.
Development is strictly determined by genetic disposition.

questions.explanation: Growth implies a change in quantity (structure, height, size), whereas Development is a physiological process involving qualitative change from a lower to a more advanced stage of complexity.

questions.question: Match the developmental milestone with the typical age of achievement:

pairs.left: No head lag when pulled to sit

questions.explanation: 3 months: Head control; 6 months: Sits steadily; 18 months: Walks independently; 36 months: Talks in sentences.
questions.hint: Head control comes first, complex speech comes last.

questions.question: Arrange the vaccines in order of their sensitivity to heat (Most sensitive at the top to Least sensitive at the bottom):
questions.explanation: The cold chain sensitivity order is: Polio (most) > Measles > DPT > BCG > Tetanus (least).
questions.hint: Polio is the most fragile vaccine regarding heat.

questions.question: Which of the following statements regarding the administration of the Pentavalent vaccine are correct? (Select all that apply)

options.text: It protects against Diphtheria, Pertussis, Tetanus, Hepatitis B, and Influenza.
It is administered at birth, 6 weeks, and 10 weeks.
It is given at 6 weeks, 10 weeks, and 14 weeks.
It should be injected into the buttock.
It should be injected into the outer aspect of the left thigh.

questions.explanation: Pentavalent is given at 6, 10, and 14 weeks into the outer aspect of the left thigh. It covers 5 diseases. Injection into the buttock is contraindicated.
questions.hint: Consider the timing schedule and the injection site safety.

questions.question: What is the term for the system concerned with the maintenance and monitoring of temperature as vaccines pass from manufacturer to user?
questions.explanation: The cold chain is the system used to ensure vaccines are kept at the correct temperature range from manufacture to administration.

questions.question: Once the BCG vaccine has been diluted, it can be stored in the refrigerator and used for up to 24 hours.
questions.explanation: Once diluted, the BCG vaccine loses its potency very quickly and must be discarded after three hours.
questions.hint: BCG is very unstable after reconstitution.

questions.question: A child not smiling at the mother by ___BLANK___ weeks is considered a developmental warning sign.

richContent.content: Note: Developmental warning signs indicate the point beyond the uppermost limit of normal at which a milestone should have been reached.

questions.explanation: Not smiling at the mother by 8 weeks is a specific warning sign indicating potential developmental delay.
questions.hint: It is equal to two months.

questions.question: Based on the table below, which age period is correctly defined?

richContent.content:
PeriodAge Definition
A. NeonatalBirth to 1 year
B. Toddler1 to 3 years
C. Preschool6 to 11 years

questions.explanation: Toddlers are defined as 1 to 3 years. Neonatal is birth to 28 days. Preschool is 3 to 6 years.
questions.hint: Look closely at the age ranges provided in the study material.

questions.question: Which of the following are examples of PASSIVE immunisation? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Transfer of maternal antibodies across the placenta
Administration of tetanus immunoglobulin for a wound

questions.explanation: Passive immunisation involves receiving ready-made antibodies (maternal transfer or immunoglobulin injection). Vaccines (BCG, OPV) stimulate the body to make antibodies (Active).
questions.hint: Think about receiving antibodies vs making them.

questions.question: Measles vaccine is administered at ___BLANK___ months of age along with Vitamin ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Measles vaccine is given at 9 months. Vitamin A (200,000 i.u.) is routinely given with it.
questions.hint: The age is less than a year.
